p: The responses of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli in chlorophylls and carotenoids contents to P. cubeba and P. nigrum EOs were presented in Figure 1. Both of EOs decreased chlorophyll a, b, total chlorophylls, and carotenoids contents of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli ranged from 15.98 to 73.00% compare with control. Compared with P. nigrum, P. cubeba EO decreased B. pilosa and E. crus-galli pigment more effective by 49.84 and 48.24% in chlorophyll a; 41.76 and 48.79% in chlorophyll b; 47.26 and 48.41% in total chlorophylls; 49.43 and 46.44% in carotenoids contents respectively.
